attributes.action: establish that all MP's and members of the House of Lords must acknowledge any written correspondence (including email) from their constituents.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We would like the PM to establish that all MP's and members of the House of Lords must ensure that they respond to all written queries (including e-mail) from their respective constituents within a sensible time-frame.

In the case of the House of Lords this will include any citizen of the United Kingdom who writes to query a vote or speech made by a member of the House of Lords in the House only.

If for any reason a representative feels that they cannot or will not answer any query, they must still acknowledge this by a response stating that they will not or cannot respond to the given query.

This is to ensure full empowerment to the people of the United Kingdom and a guarantee that no-one shall be ignored by those who create, judge and pass our legislation.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
